lines.text: [first lines]
Ah, Mr. Hawkes. I heard you were here in Juarez.
And I heard that you were patrolling this neck of the woods. My information was good.
What's good is when a man can mix business with pleasure.
My business is your pleasure, unless you're too tired to play.
You know Judge, we have no greater friend in this world than Ethan Cassidy.
Then you can walk right out to my gallows and say goodbye to your friend. Now, let's get back to the races.
Those dime novels which do nothing but glorify their subjects are a thing of the past, Mr. Earp. Now, my publisher wants the facts behind the legend; the real Wyatt Earp, warts and all, Mr. Marshal.
I don't know that warts is how I want to be remembered, Mr. Mize.
Looks like I found some military firepower down here.
The grenades? Sure, I don't reckon the army would mind giving us a hand.
Life's an adventure. Things have been pretty quiet for me lately. Good to get the old heart pumping again.
They've sent us another actor over here who can't even ride.
Well, they all say that they can't wear the mask and ride at the same time.
That doesn't matter. The sun is out.
It's possible. It's possible. Of course, that's what Custer said.
So did Crazy Horse.
Well, sir, the end of the west is near.
Get out of the way, Chinaman, or you're dead.
Death is nothing to one who does not fear it.
Mr. President, I'm surprised to see that you play poker in public.
Well, I wouldn't miss a chance to compete against the finest.
We welcome your money, sir.
As long as it is yours and not the tax payers'.
[last lines]
What was that?
Earthquake.
There's no such thing as earthquakes in San Francisco.
Lucas McCain. You haven't slowed down a bit, have you?
I'm doing the best I can.
Brady, why were they chasing you?
Card game.
Actually, it was a difference in opinion in a card game.
A man of values never places his business above friendship.
This was a friendship based on business.
Wyatt Earp will be on the lookout now that we already hit the bank.
Theo, he's an old man.
But he's still Wyatt Earp.
Senorita Burgundy, I am afraid you have embarrassed me, the Mexican army, and El Presidente; whom I faithfully serve. Under these unfortunate circumstances...
Colonel, if you're going to hang us, won't you just get to it? But don't make us sit here and listen to all of your pompous lies.
Colonel, I think what she means...

No need to apologize, Senor. Senorita Burgundy is right about my lies. What she is wrong about is the hanging. I am not going to hang you. I'm going to shoot you. Then I'm going to cut your head off to set an example.
Moving pictures. What the Hell's this world coming to, huh?
Son, like the man said, when legend becomes fact, print the legend.
Mark.
Yes, sir?
Put on the mask. Put it on.
You mean...
Yes, I mean put on the mask.
[hands Mark the Lone Ranger mask]
Here we are surrounded by beautiful muchachas and you two can't keep your hands off each other? I oughta kill you both just for being two big dumb redneck peckerwoods.
We're almost to the end of our journey.
The ultimate quest has no ending. That is what gives the quest its ultimate value.
I love it when he talks like that.
I'm definitely not the best poker player in the Maverick family.
Sorry to do this to you on your home ground, old boy. But then again, there's no good place for defeat.
You know, Sir Colin, there are very few things as satisfying as watching real artist play and you are truly that. One thing that may be though is beating that artist.
Gambling's not really about money. It's just our way of keeping score.
